intro: Hieracium pyrenaeolanatum, commonly known as the Pyrenean hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenean mountain range. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, dandelion-like blooms. It thrives in alpine and subalpine habitats, often growing in rocky or grassy areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
